items.title: 3 Bob Ross Paintings Sell for $600,000 to Support Public Broadcasters
items.summary: The landscapes by the television host were sold as part of a campaign to help public television stations weather federal funding cuts.

items.title: Kansas County Agrees to Pay $3 Million Over Police Raid of Newspaper
items.summary: The search of The Marion County Record’s office in 2023 touched off a national conversation about press freedom.

items.title: Johnson to Seat Grijalva, Seven Weeks After She Was Elected
items.summary: Speaker Mike Johnson had refused to swear in Representative-elect Adelita Grijalva, a Democrat of Arizona, claiming he lacked the power to do so.

items.title: Supreme Court Extends Order Allowing Limits on Food Stamp Payments
items.summary: The justices allowed the Trump administration to withhold full benefits for two more days while Congress worked to advance a government funding bill.

items.title: Duffy Won’t Give Timeline to Restore Flights as Shutdown Appears Near End
items.summary: The transportation secretary said data would guide the decision. He also stepped up his warnings of potential chaos, saying some airlines could ground their fleets if the shutdown continued.

items.title: Trump Administration Plans to Send Border Patrol to Charlotte and New Orleans
items.summary: Plans for the operations were still being finalized, according to a federal official with knowledge of them.

items.title: John F Kennedy’s grandson Jack Schlossberg announces run for US House seat
items.summary: <p>Schlossberg has drummed up a large following on social media with frequent posts weighing in on national issues</p><p>John F Kennedy’s grandson Jack Schlossberg has said he will run for the US House next year, announcing Tuesday that he was seeking a key New York seat set to be vacated by longtime Democrat Jerry Nadler.</p><p>“This district should have a representative who can harness the creativity, energy and drive of this district and translate that into political power in Washington,” Schlossberg said in a campaign video posted on social media late Tuesday.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/12/jack-schlossberg-jfk-john-f-kennedy-grandson-congress">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: US supreme court extends pause on Trump administration paying full November Snap benefits – as it happened
items.summary: <p>This live blog is now closed.</p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/11/trump-administration-news-updates-today">Trump news at a glance: Top House Democrats vow to oppose shutdown bill after splinter group disappoints</a></p></li></ul><p>As the supreme court deliberates on the fate of Donald Trump’s sweeping tariffs – which he maintains are a matter of “national security” as justices appeared skeptical during oral arguments on the case last week –&nbsp;the president said that the US would be forced to hand “in excess of three trillion dollars” if the levies are scrapped, in a late night post on Truth Social.</p><p>He added:</p><p>It would not be possible to ever make up for that kind of a ‘drubbing.’ That would truly become an insurmountable National Security Event, and devastating to the future of our Country – Possibly non-sustainable!</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/nov/11/donald-trump-us-government-shutdown-senate-democrats-republicans-politics-live-news-updates">Continue reading...</a>
